WorkItem.Description: When a HTTPS connection is queried for WSDL, it would be good if the tool can allow the user to select a certificate from the cert store to use.
WorkItem.Summary: Unable to retrieve WSDL from SSL web services

Comments.Message: i've no idea of the cert stuff. just want to use this tool for https wsdl. is this possible? thanks.

Initializing
Generating WSDL
System.InvalidOperationException: General Error https://<......>?WSDL ---> System.Net.WebException: There was an error downloading 'https://<......>?WSDL'. ---> System.Net.WebException: The underlying connection was closed: Could not establish trust relationship for the SSL/TLS secure channel. ---> System.Security.Authentication.AuthenticationException: The remote certificate is invalid according to the validation procedure.
...........

Initializing
Generating WSDL
System.InvalidOperationException: General Error https://<......>?WSDL ---> System.Net.WebException: There was an error downloading 'https://<......>?WSDL'. ---> System.Net.WebException: The underlying connection was closed: Could not establish trust relationship for the SSL/TLS secure channel. ---> System.Security.Authentication.AuthenticationException: The remote certificate is invalid according to the validation procedure.
...........

i tried the new version (http://code.google.com/p/webservicestudio2/downloads/detail?name=WebServiceStudio2.exe&can=2&q=) to invoke the HTTPS WSDL but i still got the error message:  System.Net.WebException: The underlying connection was closed: Could not establish trust relationship for the SSL/TLS.
Would you please test with the HTTS WSDL: https://gsxwsut.apple.com/gsx-ws/services/emea/asp?wsdl

I am currently having the same problems with .net WebService Studio, is this still a known issue or is there a work around?

Thanks

Rob

I just made one change on app to accept certificates on download WSDL and invoke methods.

Menu: Edit > Options > wsdl Settings > UseClientCert = True, and now it will prompt for certificate on invoke and "get". 

Hope it helps!
